data.name: Hexagram.62.Statement
data.value: Gòu: indicates (the condition of) a (strong) woman. Do not take (such a one) as your wife.

data.name: Hexagram.62.Commentary
data.value: Gòu means 'an encounter,' the weak (line) encountering the strong (ones). 'Do not take such a one as your wife' – (for) one cannot live together with her permanently. (Yet) when Heaven and Earth encounter each other, all things are displayed in their glory. When the strong (ruler, the fifth nine) meets with what is central and correct, his influence greatly prevails under heaven. Great indeed is the significance of the time of Gòu!

data.name: Hexagram.62.Image
data.value: Under heaven there is wind – this forms the image of Gòu. The sovereign, in accordance with this, issues his commands and proclaims them to the four quarters (of the world).

data.name: Hexagram.60.Statement
data.value: Dùn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune for the small man, but the great man will experience misfortune. The flight of the fowl supplies the means of advance.

data.name: Hexagram.60.Commentary
data.value: In Dùn, we have the weak (line, the fourth six) mounted on the strong (lines above). 'There will be good fortune for the small man' - (because) he is compliant and yielding. 'The great man will experience misfortune' - (because) he is in the place of a minister when the time is unfavorable. 'The flight of the fowl supplies the means of advance' - (because) he cannot stay in his position. The meaning of the hexagram is expressed in the movement of the lower trigram (Zhen, Thunder) which penetrates and enters into the lower part of the upper trigram (Gèn, Mountain).

data.name: Hexagram.60.Image
data.value: The mountain under heaven - this forms the image of Dùn. The superior man, in accordance with this, keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Hexagram.56.Statement
data.value: Pǐ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. In such circumstances, the superior man will stop and consider what he should do. The great depart, and the small approach.

data.name: Hexagram.56.Commentary
data.value: Pǐ means obstruction. 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when (Heaven and Earth) are in communication and harmony, all things are completed and united. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) when the superior and inferior (classes of men) are in communication, their aims are the same. 'The great depart, and the small approach' - (because) when (Heaven and Earth) are out of communication, all things are disunited and fail to grow.

data.name: Hexagram.56.Image
data.value: Heaven and earth do not unite - this forms the image of Pǐ. The superior man, in accordance with this, reduces his expenditures and retrenches his revenues, and employs men of worth, with a view to improvement of morals.

data.name: Hexagram.48.Statement
data.value: Guān: shows (the ruler) as he is present in his religious washing (before the sacrifice), but not yet presenting the offerings. (His) sincere devotion inspires reverence (in all beholders).

data.name: Hexagram.48.Commentary
data.value: The great act of contemplation is displayed from above. (The hexagram indicates) docility and penetration. (The ruler, the fifth line) being central and correct, contemplates (and is contemplated by) all under heaven. 'Guān shows (the ruler) as he is present in his religious washing, but not yet presenting the offerings. His sincere devotion inspires reverence' – those below contemplate him and are transformed. (He) contemplates the divine way of Heaven, whereby the four seasons proceed without error. The holy sage, in accordance with this divine way, establishes his instruction, and all under heaven yield submission to him.

data.name: Hexagram.48.Image
data.value: The wind moves over the earth – this forms the image of Guān. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, inspected the regions (of the kingdom), observed the people, and established instruction (according to their needs).

data.name: Hexagram.32.Statement
data.value: Bō: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will not be advantageous to make any movement. That will be advantageous which tends to promote the separation and dispersion (of what has been united).

data.name: Hexagram.32.Commentary
data.value: Bō means 'splitting apart.' 'It will not be advantageous to make any movement' - (because) when (Heaven and Earth) are separated and disunited, all things lose their mutual attraction and cohesion. 'That will be advantageous which tends to promote separation' - (because) when the superior and inferior (classes of men) are in mutual opposition, there is no union of aim and action. 'In such circumstances, the superior man will stop and consider what he should do' - (because) his virtue is great and brilliant, and he must not allow himself to be involved in the prevailing confusion.

data.name: Hexagram.32.Image
data.value: The mountain rests on the earth - this forms the image of Bō. The superior man, in accordance with this, seeks alliances with men of worth and ability, in order to restore order and unity.

data.name: Hexagram.40.Statement
data.value: Jìn: indicates that (under its conditions) the superior man will be crowned with success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream (to embark on important enterprises).

data.name: Hexagram.40.Commentary
data.value: Jìn means 'advance.' 'The superior man will be crowned with success' - (because) he adheres to what is correct and proper. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) he is assisted by the central and correct position of the fifth line (the ruler). Darkness disappears, and light advances. 'The prince offers sacrifice to his ancestral temple' - (because) he is in accord with the season (for such ceremonies).

data.name: Hexagram.40.Image
data.value: The sun shines above the earth - this forms the image of Jìn. The superior man, in accordance with this, discards all that is mean and low in his character, and aims at what is noble and lofty.

data.name: Hexagram.47.Statement
data.value: Dà Yǒu: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. Advantage will be found in having the assistance of the great man.

data.name: Hexagram.47.Commentary
data.value: Dà Yǒu means 'possession in great measure.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) the strong (line, the fifth nine) is in the central position, and responds to the weak (line, the second six) which is also central. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) the ruler is in the correct position, and the ministers are loyal and devoted. 'Advantage will be found in having the assistance of the great man' - (because) there is perfect harmony between the ruler and his ministers.

data.name: Hexagram.47.Image
data.value: Fire in heaven above - this forms the image of Dà Yǒu. The superior man, in accordance with this, restrains evil and promotes good, in accordance with the benevolent will of Heaven.

data.name: Hexagram.27.Statement
data.value: Duì: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune. There will be error if the firm correctness be not maintained.

data.name: Hexagram.27.Commentary
data.value: Duì means 'joyous.' 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) joy in company with what is great leads to the perfection of virtue. 'There will be good fortune' - (because) the strong (line, the ninth) is in the central position, and responds to the weak (line, the sixth) which is also central. 'There will be error if the firm correctness be not maintained' - (because) the joy must be regulated by propriety and reason.

data.name: Hexagram.27.Image
data.value: Lakes resting one upon another - this forms the image of Duì. The superior man, in accordance with this, discusses crimes and pardons, and makes his decisions with deliberation.

data.name: Hexagram.26.Statement
data.value: Kùn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. (But) great difficulties must not be encountered.

data.name: Hexagram.26.Commentary
data.value: Kùn means 'distress' or 'oppression.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when a superior man is in distress, he examines himself and cultivates his virtues. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) sincerity and firmness will eventually overcome all obstacles. 'Great difficulties must not be encountered' - (because) in times of oppression, rash action leads to greater trouble.

data.name: Hexagram.26.Image
data.value: Water over a lake - this forms the image of Kùn. The superior man, in accordance with this, bestows his favors and does not exhaust his resources.

data.name: Hexagram.24.Statement
data.value: Cuì: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. (But) great difficulties must not be encountered. It will be advantageous to make appointments of officers of merit.

data.name: Hexagram.24.Commentary
data.value: Cuì means 'gathering together.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when people unite with one heart, they can accomplish great things. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) sincerity and unity are essential for lasting success. 'Great difficulties must not be encountered' - (because) in gathering people together, force should not be used. 'It will be advantageous to make appointments of officers of merit' - (because) wise leadership is needed to unite people effectively.

data.name: Hexagram.24.Image
data.value: A lake on the earth - this forms the image of Cuì. The superior man, in accordance with this, repairs his weapons and prepares his defenses.

data.name: Hexagram.28.Statement
data.value: Xián: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. Perseverance brings advantage. Taking a maiden to wife brings good fortune.

data.name: Hexagram.28.Commentary
data.value: Xián means 'mutual influence' or 'attraction.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) when feelings of sympathy and affection exist between people, they naturally attract and influence each other. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) sincerity and constancy are essential in all relationships. 'Taking a maiden to wife brings good fortune' - (because) the union of male and female represents the fundamental principle of nature.

data.name: Hexagram.28.Image
data.value: A lake on a mountain - this forms the image of Xián. The superior man, in accordance with this, keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Hexagram.20.Statement
data.value: Jiǎn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) the superior man will be able to make progress. But he must cultivate the qualities represented by the central and correct position of the fifth line.

data.name: Hexagram.20.Commentary
data.value: Jiǎn means 'obstruction' or 'difficulty.' 'The superior man will be able to make progress' - (because) when difficulties arise, a wise man examines himself and cultivates his virtues. 'He must cultivate the qualities represented by the central and correct position' - (because) in times of difficulty, the middle path and correct principles are essential for success. 'Going forward brings praise' - (because) perseverance and determination will eventually overcome all obstacles.

data.name: Hexagram.20.Image
data.value: A mountain on water - this forms the image of Jiǎn. The superior man, in accordance with this, turns back upon himself and examines his character, cultivating his virtues.

data.name: Hexagram.4.Statement
data.value: Qiān: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. The superior man will achieve his purpose by means of small advances.

data.name: Hexagram.4.Commentary
data.value: Qiān means 'modesty' or 'humility.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) modesty is a virtue that leads to the perfection of character. 'The superior man will achieve his purpose by means of small advances' - (because) humility and gradual progress are more sustainable than rash action. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) modesty enables one to overcome great difficulties.

data.name: Hexagram.4.Image
data.value: A mountain within the earth - this forms the image of Qiān. The superior man, in accordance with this, reduces his faults and cultivates his virtues.

data.name: Hexagram.12.Statement
data.value: Xiǎo Guò: indicates that (under its conditions) success will come through small efforts. Perseverance brings advantage. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man. (But) let there be no attempt to perform great exploits.

data.name: Hexagram.12.Commentary
data.value: Xiǎo Guò means 'preponderance of the small.' 'Success will come through small efforts' - (because) in small matters, attention to detail and careful execution lead to success. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) constancy in small things builds the foundation for greater achievements. 'It will be advantageous to meet with the great man' - (because) wise counsel is needed in times of small preponderance. 'Let there be no attempt to perform great exploits' - (because) attempting great things when the time is for small actions leads to failure.

data.name: Hexagram.12.Image
data.value: Thunder on the mountain - this forms the image of Xiǎo Guò. The superior man, in accordance with this, is careful in his speech and temperate in his conduct.

data.name: Hexagram.11.Statement
data.value: Guī Mèi: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.11.Commentary
data.value: Guī Mèi means 'the marrying maiden.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) the union of man and woman represents the fundamental principle of nature. 'But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) in matters of marriage and relationships, propriety and moral principles must be maintained. 'The young lady who marries carries her basket, but without the fruits of the sacrifice' - (because) appearance without substance is empty. 'The lame man who can trample on the tiger's tail and does not bite him' - (because) weakness guided by wisdom can overcome strength.

data.name: Hexagram.11.Image
data.value: Thunder over a lake - this forms the image of Guī Mèi. The superior man, in accordance with this, delays his marriage and awaits the proper time.

data.name: Hexagram.45.Statement
data.value: Lí: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to persevere. Success depends on what is firm and correct. It will be advantageous to have the assistance of the great man.

data.name: Hexagram.45.Commentary
data.value: Lí means 'clinging' or 'attachment.' 'It will be advantageous to persevere' - (because) when one clings to what is right and proper, success will follow. 'Success depends on what is firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper conduct leads to favorable outcomes. 'It will be advantageous to have the assistance of the great man' - (because) wise guidance is needed when clinging to the right path. 'Care must be taken not to let the cow escape' - (because) vigilance is required to maintain what is good.

data.name: Hexagram.45.Image
data.value: Fire clinging to wood - this forms the image of Lí. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his brightness and makes his character brilliant.

data.name: Hexagram.44.Statement
data.value: Lǚ: indicates that (under its conditions) the wanderer will be successful. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.44.Commentary
data.value: Lǚ means 'the wanderer.' 'The wanderer will be successful' - (because) when one travels with proper preparation and maintains correct principles, success will follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for the traveler. 'The wanderer's hostelry burns' - (because) carelessness leads to disaster. 'He loses his ox - there will be evil' - (because) losing what sustains one leads to misfortune.

data.name: Hexagram.44.Image
data.value: Fire on a mountain - this forms the image of Lǚ. The superior man, in accordance with this, observes customs and ceremonies, and understands the principles of hospitality.

data.name: Hexagram.46.Statement
data.value: Dǐng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage.

data.name: Hexagram.46.Commentary
data.value: Dǐng means 'the cauldron.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) the cauldron represents transformation and nourishment, essential for civilization. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) consistent effort in refining and improving oneself leads to success. 'The cauldron has golden ears and a bronze carrying-ring' - (because) proper tools and resources are needed for great undertakings. 'The cauldron turns upside down' - (because) improper use leads to failure.

data.name: Hexagram.46.Image
data.value: Fire over wood - this forms the image of Dǐng. The superior man, in accordance with this, establishes his decrees and reforms his institutions.

data.name: Hexagram.42.Statement
data.value: Wèi Jì: indicates progress and success (in the end). (But it is like) a young fox that has almost crossed the stream, (when) its tail gets immersed. There will be no advantage in any way.

data.name: Hexagram.42.Commentary
data.value: 'Wèi Jì indicates progress and success' – (because) the yielding (line, the sixth five) attains the central place. 'A young fox that has almost crossed the stream' – (shows it) has not yet escaped from danger (the center of the water). 'Its tail gets immersed. There will be no advantage' – (because it) cannot continue to the end. Although (the lines) are not in their correct positions, the strong and the weak (lines) respond to each other.

data.name: Hexagram.42.Image
data.value: Fire above Water forms the image of Wèi Jì (Before Completion). The superior man, in accordance with this, carefully discriminates among things and arranges them in their proper places.

data.name: Hexagram.34.Statement
data.value: Méng: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. What is not correct will not be advantageous.

data.name: Hexagram.34.Commentary
data.value: Méng means 'youthful folly' or 'inexperience.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) with proper guidance and education, ignorance can be transformed into wisdom. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles is essential for learning and growth. 'Not accepting discipline - there will be evil' - (because) refusing instruction leads to failure. 'Taking a wife - good fortune' - (because) proper relationships are fundamental to human development.

data.name: Hexagram.34.Image
data.value: A spring wells up at the foot of a mountain - this forms the image of Méng. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his character and develops his talents.

data.name: Hexagram.50.Statement
data.value: Huàn: indicates that there will be progress and success. The king approaches his ancestral temple. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream (i.e., to embark on significant ventures). Advantage will be found in being firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.50.Commentary
data.value: Huàn indicates progress and success. (For) the strong (line, the second nine) comes (from the upper trigram) and is not exhausted (in the lower). The weak (line, the fourth six) gets its (proper) place without (the trigram), and (its subject) ascends to (the king, the fifth line, to) unite with him. 'The king approaches his ancestral temple' – the king (then) is in the (proper) central position. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' – (for he) embarking on wood (i.e., a boat) will achieve success.

data.name: Hexagram.50.Image
data.value: The wind blows over the water – this forms the image of Huàn. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, presented offerings to the Lord of Heaven and established the ancestral temple.

data.name: Hexagram.58.Statement
data.value: Sòng: indicates that (though there is) sincerity (in the heart), it is obstructed. Being cautious and apprehensive (in the midst of contention) will bring good fortune in the end. (But) to carry the contention to the bitter end will bring misfortune. It is advantageous to see the great man (for judgment). It is not advantageous to cross the great stream (to venture into danger).

data.name: Hexagram.58.Commentary
data.value: In Sòng, we have strength above and danger below; (there is) danger (within) and strength (without) – hence contention. 'Sòng indicates that (though there is) sincerity, it is obstructed. Being cautious and apprehensive will bring good fortune in the end' – (because) the strong (line, the second nine) has come and is in the central position. '(But) to carry it to the bitter end will bring misfortune' – contention cannot lead to success. 'It is advantageous to see the great man' – (because) he honors what is central and correct. 'It is not advantageous to cross the great stream' – (for) one would fall into the abyss.

data.name: Hexagram.58.Image
data.value: Heaven and water move in opposite directions – this forms the image of Sòng. The superior man, in accordance with this, in every undertaking takes thought about its beginning.

data.name: Hexagram.61.Statement
data.value: Tóng Rén: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in crossing the great stream.

data.name: Hexagram.61.Commentary
data.value: Tóng Rén means 'fellowship with men' or 'union with men.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when people unite with one heart and purpose, great achievements are possible. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles ensures lasting unity. 'There will be good fortune in crossing the great stream' - (because) collective effort can overcome great obstacles. 'The superior man discriminates between things and makes ready to attack the cities' - (because) even in unity, justice and discrimination are necessary.

data.name: Hexagram.61.Image
data.value: Heaven above fire - this forms the image of Tóng Rén. The superior man, in accordance with this, distinguishes between things and makes ready to attack the cities.

data.name: Hexagram.9.Statement
data.value: Zhèn: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.9.Commentary
data.value: Zhèn means 'the arousing' or 'excitation.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) when action is taken with proper preparation and determination, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for effective action. 'Laughing and talking - good fortune' - (because) confidence and joy accompany proper action. 'Fear and trembling - misfortune' - (because) hesitation and fear lead to failure.

data.name: Hexagram.9.Image
data.value: Thunder repeated - this forms the image of Zhèn. The superior man, in accordance with this, is fearful and apprehensive, cultivates virtue, and examines his character.

data.name: Hexagram.8.Statement
data.value: Yù: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to set armies marching to chastise (the rebellious); and there will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.8.Commentary
data.value: Yù means 'enthusiasm' or 'following with joy.' 'It will be advantageous to set armies marching' - (because) when people are united with enthusiasm and purpose, they can accomplish great things. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) genuine enthusiasm and unity lead to success wherever they are directed. 'Setting forth in accordance with orders' - (because) proper leadership and discipline are essential for collective action.

data.name: Hexagram.8.Image
data.value: Thunder coming forth from the earth - this forms the image of Yù. The superior man, in accordance with this, establishes his ordinances and promulgates them among the people.

data.name: Hexagram.10.Statement
data.value: Xiè: indicates that (in the case which it presupposes) there will be advantage in moving towards the southwest. If no (further) movement is made, coming back (to the old conditions) will be fortunate. If some movement must be made, doing it early will be fortunate.

data.name: Hexagram.10.Commentary
data.value: In Xiè we have (the trigram for) danger (坎) and that for movement. By movement one escapes the danger – hence it is called Liberation. 'Xiè indicates advantage in moving towards the southwest' – (because) going (there) will gain the multitude. 'Coming back will be fortunate' – (for) he thereby attains the central position (of rest). 'If some movement must be made, doing it early will be fortunate' – (for) going will achieve merit. When Heaven and Earth are set free, thunder and rain come forth. When thunder and rain come forth, the hundred fruits, grasses, and trees all burst their husks and sprouts. Great indeed is the significance of the time of Liberation!

data.name: Hexagram.10.Image
data.value: Thunder and rain come forth – this forms the image of Xiè. The superior man, in accordance with this, pardons errors and forgives misdeeds.

data.name: Hexagram.14.Statement
data.value: Héng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be no error.

data.name: Hexagram.14.Commentary
data.value: Héng means 'duration' or 'permanence.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when principles and purposes are maintained consistently, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for lasting achievement. 'There will be no error' - (because) proper conduct sustained over time leads to correctness. 'The noble man abides in virtue and accumulates excellence' - (because) continuous cultivation of virtue leads to greatness.

data.name: Hexagram.14.Image
data.value: Thunder and wind - this forms the image of Héng. The superior man, in accordance with this, stands firm and does not change his purpose.

data.name: Hexagram.6.Statement
data.value: Shēng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.6.Commentary
data.value: Shēng means 'pushing upward' or 'ascending.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one progresses steadily and persistently, advancement follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and adherence to moral principles are essential for true advancement. 'The great prince will present offerings to the ancestral temple' - (because) proper reverence and ceremony are part of upward progress. 'It will be advantageous to see the great man' - (because) wise guidance is needed for proper advancement.

data.name: Hexagram.6.Image
data.value: Within the earth grows a tree - this forms the image of Shēng. The superior man, in accordance with this, accumulates goodness and enlarges his virtue.

data.name: Hexagram.22.Statement
data.value: Jǐng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.22.Commentary
data.value: Jǐng means 'the well.' 'There will be success' - (because) when resources are properly maintained and shared, they benefit all. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) well-maintained resources enable great undertakings. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper maintenance and use of resources require constancy and correctness. 'The town may be changed, but the well cannot be changed' - (because) fundamental resources and principles remain constant. 'The well is clean and bright' - (because) proper care ensures purity and usefulness.

data.name: Hexagram.22.Image
data.value: Water over wood - this forms the image of Jǐng. The superior man, in accordance with this, comforts the people and encourages them to help one another.

data.name: Hexagram.30.Statement
data.value: Dà Guò: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.30.Commentary
data.value: Dà Guò means 'preponderance of the great' or 'great excess.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when extraordinary measures are needed, bold action can lead to success. 'But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) even in times of excess, moral principles must be maintained. 'The ridge-pole sags' - (because) when the load is too great, support systems fail. 'The willow is bent' - (because) flexibility is needed to handle extraordinary situations.

data.name: Hexagram.30.Image
data.value: The lake has risen above the trees - this forms the image of Dà Guò. The superior man, in accordance with this, stands aloof from the world and keeps his virtue free from stain.

data.name: Hexagram.25.Statement
data.value: Suí: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be no error.

data.name: Hexagram.25.Commentary
data.value: Suí means 'following.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one follows the right path and proper leadership, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles is essential even in following others. 'There will be no error' - (because) proper following leads to correctness. 'The official receives his badge' - (because) proper recognition comes to those who follow correctly. 'He meets with bad luck in the western quarter' - (because) following the wrong path leads to misfortune.

data.name: Hexagram.25.Image
data.value: Thunder in the midst of a lake - this forms the image of Suí. The superior man, in accordance with this, goes to see the great man at the proper time.

data.name: Hexagram.54.Statement
data.value: Xùn: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.54.Commentary
data.value: Xùn means 'the gentle' or 'penetration.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) gentle but persistent action can penetrate and influence even the hardest substances. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and moral principles are essential for effective gentle action. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) gentle persistence leads to success in all endeavors. 'Repeated compliance brings humiliation' - (because) excessive yielding without principle leads to degradation.

data.name: Hexagram.54.Image
data.value: Wind following wind - this forms the image of Xùn. The superior man, in accordance with this, administers his commands and carries out his undertakings.

data.name: Hexagram.55.Statement
data.value: Xiǎo Chù: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Hexagram.55.Commentary
data.value: Xiǎo Chù means 'the taming power of the small.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when small forces are properly applied with persistence, they can achieve significant results. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) constancy and moral principles are essential for effective action. 'There will be good fortune' - (because) proper application of gentle but persistent force leads to favorable outcomes. 'The wind drives away the clouds' - (because) gentle but consistent action can disperse obstacles.

data.name: Hexagram.55.Image
data.value: Wind blowing over heaven - this forms the image of Xiǎo Chù. The superior man, in accordance with this, refines his manners and nourishes his virtue.

data.name: Hexagram.53.Statement
data.value: Jiā Rén: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be good fortune. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.53.Commentary
data.value: Jiā Rén means 'the family' or 'relations within the home.' 'There will be good fortune' - (because) when family relationships are properly ordered, harmony and prosperity follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper roles within the family leads to success. 'The wife and children are firm and correct' - (because) proper conduct within the family creates a stable foundation. 'The father exercises authority' - (because) proper leadership within the family ensures order and harmony.

data.name: Hexagram.53.Image
data.value: Wind comes forth from fire - this forms the image of Jiā Rén. The superior man, in accordance with this, speaks with gravity and deliberation, and cultivates his character.

data.name: Hexagram.49.Statement
data.value: Yì: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.49.Commentary
data.value: Yì means 'increase.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when resources are properly allocated and shared, growth and success follow. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) increased resources and capabilities enable great undertakings. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper allocation of resources requires moral principles and constancy. 'One makes offerings to the imperial ancestor' - (because) sharing benefits with others and honoring traditions are essential aspects of increase.

data.name: Hexagram.49.Image
data.value: Wind over thunder - this forms the image of Yì. The superior man, in accordance with this, does not accumulate his wealth, but shares it with others.

data.name: Hexagram.57.Statement
data.value: Wú Wàng: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be success and progress. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream.

data.name: Hexagram.57.Commentary
data.value: Wú Wàng means 'innocence' or 'freedom from false expectations.' 'There will be success and progress' - (because) when one acts with pure intentions and without ulterior motives, success follows naturally. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and honest action leads to favorable outcomes. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) innocent action with pure intentions can overcome great obstacles. 'If one does not cultivate his fields, he will have misfortune' - (because) neglecting one's duties leads to failure.

data.name: Hexagram.57.Image
data.value: Thunder rolls beneath heaven - this forms the image of Wú Wàng. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his character and maintains his integrity.

data.name: Hexagram.41.Statement
data.value: Shì Kè: indicates successful progress. It will be advantageous to use legal constraints (or: to proceed with legal punishments).

data.name: Hexagram.41.Commentary
data.value: 'There is something between the jaws' – hence it is called Shì Kè (Biting Through). 'Biting through leads to success.' (For) the strong and the weak lines are clearly divided; there is movement and clarity. 'Thunder and lightning combine' to make things manifest. The yielding line attains the central place and moves upward. Although (the fifth line) is not in its correct (strong) position, 'it is advantageous to use legal constraints.'

data.name: Hexagram.41.Image
data.value: Thunder and lightning together form the image of Shì Kè. The ancient kings, in accordance with this, clarified the penalties and made the laws clear (to all).

data.name: Hexagram.33.Statement
data.value: Yí: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.33.Commentary
data.value: Yí means 'the corners of the mouth' or 'the jaw.' 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) when one is nourished properly and maintains good relationships, success follows in all endeavors. 'The superior man takes his food and nourishment' - (because) proper sustenance and care are essential for well-being. 'Seeking nourishment through proper channels' - (because) obtaining what one needs through appropriate means leads to harmony.

data.name: Hexagram.33.Image
data.value: Thunder and wind - this forms the image of Yí. The superior man, in accordance with this, is careful of his words and temperate in eating.

data.name: Hexagram.38.Statement
data.value: Gǔ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.38.Commentary
data.value: Gǔ means 'work on the decayed' or 'restoration.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one addresses problems and restores what has deteriorated, renewal and success follow. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) proper restoration efforts can overcome great challenges. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper methods are essential for effective restoration. 'The king approaches his ancestral temple' - (because) honoring traditions and restoring proper order are fundamental duties.

data.name: Hexagram.38.Image
data.value: Wind beneath the mountain - this forms the image of Gǔ. The superior man, in accordance with this, encourages people and nurtures their character.

data.name: Hexagram.18.Statement
data.value: Kǎn: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.18.Commentary
data.value: Kǎn means 'the abysmal' or 'water.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one faces difficulties with perseverance and proper conduct, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and constancy are essential for overcoming challenges. 'The water flows on uninterruptedly and reaches its goal' - (because) persistent effort and proper direction lead to success. 'The water fills up the holes and caverns' - (because) thoroughness and attention to detail are necessary for complete success.

data.name: Hexagram.18.Image
data.value: Water flows on continuously - this forms the image of Kǎn. The superior man, in accordance with this, practices virtue and cultivates his character.

data.name: Hexagram.19.Statement
data.value: Jié: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.19.Commentary
data.value: Jié means 'limitation' or 'restraint.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one knows and accepts proper limitations, success and harmony follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper boundaries leads to favorable outcomes. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) proper limitation enables effective action in all directions. 'Genuine sincerity can overcome the obstacle of timidity' - (because) honesty and authenticity can dispel fears.

data.name: Hexagram.19.Image
data.value: Water over a lake - this forms the image of Jié. The superior man, in accordance with this, establishes his words and confirms his actions.

data.name: Hexagram.17.Statement
data.value: Zhūn: indicates that great progress and success (will follow). Advantage will be found in being firm and correct. Do not engage in active movement anywhere. It is advantageous to appoint feudal lords (to establish order).

data.name: Hexagram.17.Commentary
data.value: In Zhūn, we have the first intercourse of the strong (yang) and weak (yin) lines, and the consequent birth of difficulty. (We have the trigram indicating) movement in the midst of danger. Through great perseverance and correctness, there will be prosperity and success. (The action of) thunder and rain fills (the atmosphere). (This represents) the creative action of Heaven, when all was chaotic and obscure. It is the proper time for appointing feudal lords (to establish order), but there will be no rest (i.e., tranquility is not yet attained).

data.name: Hexagram.17.Image
data.value: Clouds and thunder – this forms the image of Zhūn. The superior man, in accordance with this, weaves the threads of order (out of chaos).

data.name: Hexagram.21.Statement
data.value: Jì Jì: indicates progress and success in small matters. There will be advantage in being firm and correct. There is good fortune in the beginning, but disorder may appear in the end.

data.name: Hexagram.21.Commentary
data.value: 'Jì Jì indicates progress and success' – that is, in small matters. 'There will be advantage in being firm and correct' – (for) the strong and the weak lines are in their correct places, each in its appropriate position. 'There is good fortune in the beginning' – (because) the weak (second line) is in the center. 'Disorder may appear in the end' – because the course (represented by the hexagram) has been exhausted.

data.name: Hexagram.21.Image
data.value: Water over Fire forms the image of Jì Jì (After Completion). The superior man, in accordance with this, thinks of calamity and guards against it beforehand.

data.name: Hexagram.29.Statement
data.value: Gé: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.29.Commentary
data.value: Gé means 'revolution' or 'change.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when change is properly timed and executed, renewal and success follow. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles ensures proper change. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) well-timed revolution leads to favorable outcomes. 'The great man brings about change at the proper time' - (because) wise leadership is essential for successful transformation.

data.name: Hexagram.29.Image
data.value: Fire in the midst of water - this forms the image of Gé. The superior man, in accordance with this, sets his calendar in order and makes the seasons clear.

data.name: Hexagram.13.Statement
data.value: Feng: indicates progress and development. A king (as if) approached it. Be not anxious. Let it be like the sun at noon.

data.name: Hexagram.13.Commentary
data.value: Feng means great. (The trigram for) light (Fire) and that for movement (Thunder) are combined; hence the figure indicates abundance. 'A king (as if) approached it' - his mind is set on what is great. 'Be not anxious. Let it be like the sun at noon' - for it is right that (the sun) should shine over all the world. When the sun has reached its meridian height, it begins to decline. When the moon has become full, it begins to wane. The heaven and earth's conditions of abundance and attenuation wax and wane in accordance with the seasons. How much more is it so with the fate of humans, and (the operations of) the spirits and gods?

data.name: Hexagram.13.Image
data.value: (The trigrams for) thunder and lightning come together, forming the image of Feng (Abundance). The superior man, in accordance with this, decides cases of litigation and inflicts punishments (clearly and promptly).

data.name: Hexagram.5.Statement
data.value: Míng Yí: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to realize the difficulty (of the position) and maintain firm correctness.

data.name: Hexagram.5.Commentary
data.value: The light (sun) has sunk into the earth: this is Míng Yí. (The hexagram teaches) one to keep his brilliant qualities concealed within and to maintain a submissive deportment without, thereby enduring great distress. King Wen (of Zhou) acted thus. 'It will be advantageous to realize the difficulty and maintain firm correctness' – (that is, one should) obscure his light (for the time being). Though involved in inner distress, to be able to correct his aim and hold it fast – the Viscount of Ji (Jizi) acted thus.

data.name: Hexagram.5.Image
data.value: The light (sun) has sunk into the earth – this forms the image of Míng Yí. The superior man, in accordance with this, when dealing with the multitude, veils his brightness yet still remains luminous (in his governance).

data.name: Hexagram.2.Statement
data.value: Shī: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. Let the eldest son direct the army.

data.name: Hexagram.2.Commentary
data.value: Shī means 'the army' or 'multitude.' 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) when an army is properly led and disciplined, success follows in all endeavors. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) a well-led army can overcome great obstacles. 'Let the eldest son direct the army' - (because) proper leadership and authority are essential for military success. 'The host answers to the orders issued' - (because) discipline and obedience are fundamental to military effectiveness.

data.name: Hexagram.2.Image
data.value: Water over the earth - this forms the image of Shī. The superior man, in accordance with this, tolerates differences and nurtures the multitudes.

data.name: Hexagram.36.Statement
data.value: Biān: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.36.Commentary
data.value: Biān means 'keeping still' or 'mountain.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one knows when to remain still and when to act, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper timing are essential for success. 'Keeping his back still' - (because) knowing when to withdraw and remain inactive is wisdom. 'He does not serve his own interest' - (because) selflessness and proper perspective lead to greater achievements.

data.name: Hexagram.36.Image
data.value: Mountains standing close together - this forms the image of Biān. The superior man, in accordance with this, keeps his thoughts retired and does not allow himself to be disturbed.

data.name: Hexagram.37.Statement
data.value: Bì: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.37.Commentary
data.value: Bì means 'grace' or 'embellishment.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one adorns and improves what is appropriate, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper embellishment must be grounded in moral principles and correctness. 'The king approaches his ancestral temple' - (because) proper ceremony and adornment honor traditions. 'He presents his productions to the Son of Heaven' - (because) offering one's best work with proper presentation leads to recognition.

data.name: Hexagram.37.Image
data.value: Fire at the foot of the mountain - this forms the image of Bì. The superior man, in accordance with this, refines his manners and embellishes his character.

data.name: Hexagram.39.Statement
data.value: Dà Chù: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream.

data.name: Hexagram.39.Commentary
data.value: Dà Chù means 'the taming power of the great.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when great forces are properly directed and controlled, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper control of great power requires moral principles and constancy. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) well-directed great power leads to favorable outcomes. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) properly controlled great power can overcome great obstacles.

data.name: Hexagram.39.Image
data.value: Heaven within the mountain - this forms the image of Dà Chù. The superior man, in accordance with this, acquaints himself with many sayings of antiquity and many deeds of the past.

data.name: Hexagram.35.Statement
data.value: Sǔn: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be prosperity and success. There will be no error. What is firm and correct may be maintained. Advantage will be found in every movement that shall be made. In what way can this be exemplified? (Even) with two baskets of simple offerings (presented with sincerity), there may be an approach (to the spirit of Heaven).

data.name: Hexagram.35.Commentary
data.value: In Sǔn, we have the diminution of what is below (to increase) what is above; the way (of the lower trigram) is directed upward. 'Diminution with sincerity brings supreme good fortune, no error, firm correctness, and advantage in movement.' 'How is this exemplified? Two baskets may be used in the sacrifice.' The use of two baskets must be at the proper time. Diminishing the firm and increasing the yielding must take place at the proper time. The processes of decrease and increase, of fullness and emptiness, go on in correspondence with the conditions of the time.

data.name: Hexagram.35.Image
data.value: At the foot of the mountain lies the lake – this forms the image of Sǔn. The superior man, in accordance with this, restrains his wrath and curbs his desires.

data.name: Hexagram.43.Statement
data.value: Lí: indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made. What is firm and correct may be maintained.

data.name: Hexagram.43.Commentary
data.value: Lí means 'opposition' or 'fire.' 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) when one maintains proper principles despite opposition, success follows. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) adherence to correct principles leads to favorable outcomes regardless of circumstances. 'What is firm and correct may be maintained' - (because) truth and virtue endure despite external challenges.

data.name: Hexagram.43.Image
data.value: Fire clinging to fire - this forms the image of Lí. The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his brightness and makes his character brilliant.

data.name: Hexagram.59.Statement
data.value: Lǚ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.59.Commentary
data.value: Lǚ means 'treading' or 'conduct.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one treads the proper path with correct conduct, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and proper behavior are essential for success. 'Treading with the tail in the water' - (because) proceeding cautiously and humbly leads to safety. 'The king pronounces his mandates' - (because) proper conduct and clear communication are fundamental to leadership.

data.name: Hexagram.59.Image
data.value: Heaven above the lake - this forms the image of Lǚ. The superior man, in accordance with this, discriminates between high and low and establishes the course of superior men.

data.name: Hexagram.51.Statement
data.value: Zhōng Fú: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.51.Commentary
data.value: Zhōng Fú means 'inner truth' or 'sincerity.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when one acts with genuine sincerity and inner truth, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and honest conduct are essential for success. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) sincere action leads to favorable outcomes. 'The cry of the cock announces the dawn' - (because) genuine sincerity spreads and influences others.

data.name: Hexagram.51.Image
data.value: Wind over wind - this forms the image of Zhōng Fú. The superior man, in accordance with this, deliberates about his words and confirms his actions.

data.name: Hexagram.52.Statement
data.value: Jiàn: indicates that (in the case which it presupposes) the maiden will be given in marriage. There will be good fortune. Advantage will be found in being firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.52.Commentary
data.value: The progress in Jiàn is like the (happy) marriage of a maiden. 'Advancing and attaining one's proper position' – going forward will achieve merit. Advancing by the correct path can set the state in order. (The fifth line) is in its position, the strong (line) having gained the central (place). (The hexagram indicates) stopping (艮) and (then) penetrating – movement that is not exhausted.

data.name: Hexagram.52.Image
data.value: On the mountain, there is a tree – this forms the image of Jiàn. The superior man, in accordance with this, dwells in worthy virtue and improves the manners (and morals) of the people.

data.name: Hexagram.0.Statement
data.value: Kūn: what is great and originating, penetrating, advantageous, correct and firm.

data.name: Hexagram.0.Commentary
data.value: The Judgment on the Decision says: Kūn is characterized by great completeness, and corresponds to the utmost in flexibility. Its attributes are docility, capacity for endurance, and freedom from prejudice. It is the complement of Qian (Heaven). The superior man, in accordance with this, cultivates his character and brings his talents into action. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Hexagram.0.Image
data.value: The earth's condition is receptive devotion - thus the superior man who has breadth of character carries the outer world.

data.name: Hexagram.1.Statement
data.value: Fù: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.1.Commentary
data.value: Fù means 'return' or 'recurrence.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one returns to the right path and proper principles, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) adherence to moral principles and constancy are essential for proper return. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) returning to proper principles leads to favorable outcomes. 'Seven days and the return comes' - (because) natural cycles and proper timing govern all things.

data.name: Hexagram.1.Image
data.value: Thunder in the midst of the earth - this forms the image of Fù. The superior man, in accordance with this, shuts his doors and keeps still.

data.name: Hexagram.3.Statement
data.value: Lín: indicates great progress and success, while perseverance will be advantageous. But (it warns that) by the eighth month there will be misfortune.

data.name: Hexagram.3.Commentary
data.value: In Lín, the strong (yang lines) gradually advance and grow. There is joyousness and docility; the strong (line, the second nine) is in the central position and finds response. Through great penetration and correctness, one follows the way of Heaven. 'By the eighth month there will be misfortune' – because the decay (of the strong) will not be long in coming.

data.name: Hexagram.3.Image
data.value: The earth above the lake forms the image of Lín (Approach). The superior man, in accordance with this, is unceasing in his teaching and thoughtfulness, and inexhaustible in his tolerance and protection of the people.

data.name: Hexagram.7.Statement
data.value: Tài: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. The superior man will attain his purpose by means of small advances.

data.name: Hexagram.7.Commentary
data.value: Tài means 'peace' or 'greatness.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when Heaven and Earth are in harmony, all things flourish. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) constancy in virtue leads to lasting success. 'The superior man will attain his purpose by means of small advances' - (because) gradual progress is more sustainable than rash action.

data.name: Hexagram.7.Image
data.value: Heaven and earth unite - this forms the image of Tài. The superior man, in accordance with this, brings together the noble and the common people, and maintains harmony among all classes.

data.name: Hexagram.15.Statement
data.value: Dà Zhuàng: indicates that (under its conditions) it will be advantageous to be firm and correct.

data.name: Hexagram.15.Commentary
data.value: Dà Zhuàng means 'the power of the great' or 'great strength.' 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) when great power is properly directed and controlled by moral principles, success follows. 'The superior man will not advance to contend with anyone' - (because) true strength lies in self-restraint and proper conduct. 'The ram butts against the fence and gets his horns entangled' - (because) reckless use of power leads to entrapment.

data.name: Hexagram.15.Image
data.value: Thunder in heaven above - this forms the image of Dà Zhuàng. The superior man, in accordance with this, does not take any step that is not in accordance with propriety.

data.name: Hexagram.31.Statement
data.value: Guài: indicates (the necessity of) making a declaration in the royal court, and with sincere earnestness proclaiming (the offender's) guilt. There is peril (in this). (One should) make the announcement to his own city. It is not advantageous to resort to arms at once. What is advantageous is to undertake some (decisive) action.

data.name: Hexagram.31.Commentary
data.value: Guài means 'to resolve' or 'to decide,' indicating the strong deciding about the weak. (It shows the attributes of) strength and joyousness – resolution leading to harmony. 'Making a declaration in the royal court' – (because) the weak (line, the top six) rides on five strong lines. 'With sincere earnestness proclaiming the danger' – the peril (of the situation) is thus made clear to all. 'Making the announcement to his own city. It is not advantageous to resort to arms at once' – for the course (of force) advocated would be exhausted. 'What is advantageous is to undertake some action' – (for) the growth of the strong (power) will thereby be brought to its conclusion.

data.name: Hexagram.31.Image
data.value: The lake rises to heaven – this forms the image of Guài. The superior man, in accordance with this, bestows blessings (or emoluments) upon those below. If he were to hoard his virtue, it would give cause for resentment.

data.name: Hexagram.23.Statement
data.value: Xū: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. Perseverance brings advantage. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream.

data.name: Hexagram.23.Commentary
data.value: Xū means 'waiting' or 'need.' 'There will be great progress and success' - (because) when one waits patiently for the right time, success follows. 'Perseverance brings advantage' - (because) constancy and patience are essential virtues. 'It will be advantageous to cross the great stream' - (because) proper timing enables one to overcome great obstacles. 'In the city, there is no need to resort to arms' - (because) patience and forbearance are more effective than force.

data.name: Hexagram.23.Image
data.value: Clouds rise up to heaven - this forms the image of Xū. The superior man, in accordance with this, eats and drinks, and is cheerful and of good courage.

data.name: Hexagram.16.Statement
data.value: Bǐ: indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Hexagram.16.Commentary
data.value: Bǐ means 'holding together' or 'union.' 'There will be progress and success' - (because) when people unite with a common purpose, success follows. 'It will be advantageous to be firm and correct' - (because) proper principles and constancy are essential for lasting unity. 'There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made' - (because) genuine unity leads to favorable outcomes. 'Seeking union with those of the same mind' - (because) true fellowship is based on shared values and principles.

data.name: Hexagram.16.Image
data.value: Water on the earth - this forms the image of Bǐ. The superior man, in accordance with this, bestows his favors and gathers people around him.

data.name: Hexagram.63.Statement
data.value: Sublime success, perseverance furthers.

data.name: Hexagram.63.Commentary
data.value: Indeed sublime is the creative power of the Creative. All things owe their beginning to it. It leads through the clouds and brings rain. It completes all species. Brightly shines the Creative from beginning to end. Each of the six stages reaches its proper time. Mounted on six dragons, it governs the heavens. The way of the Creative works through change and transformation, so that each thing receives its true nature and destiny and all is in accord with the Great Harmony. Thus it furthers to persevere. At the head of things, it leads all to their destiny. All nations are at peace.

data.name: Hexagram.63.Image
data.value: The movement of heaven is full of power. Thus the superior man strengthens himself without ceasing.

data.name: Line.63.First.Statement
data.value: Hidden dragon. Do not act.

data.name: Line.63.First.Image
data.value: 'Hidden dragon. Do not act.' – The yang is at the bottom.

data.name: Line.63.Second.Statement
data.value: Dragon appearing in the field. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.

data.name: Line.63.Second.Image
data.value: 'Dragon appearing in the field' – Virtue is widely spread.

data.name: Line.63.Third.Statement
data.value: The superior man is active and vigilant all the day, and in the evening still careful and apprehensive. (The position is) dangerous, but there will be no mistake.

data.name: Line.63.Third.Image
data.value: 'Active and vigilant all day' – Going back and forth, following the Way.

data.name: Line.63.Fourth.Statement
data.value: (The dragon is) looking as if he were leaping up, but still in the deep. There will be no mistake.

data.name: Line.63.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Looking as if leaping up, still in the deep' – Advancing brings no blame.

data.name: Line.63.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Flying dragon in the heavens. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.

data.name: Line.63.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Flying dragon in the heavens' – The great man creates.

data.name: Line.63.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.

data.name: Line.63.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Arrogant dragon will have cause to repent' – Fullness cannot last long.

data.name: Line.13.First.Statement
data.value: He meets his complementary ruler. Though they are (both) of the same character, there will be no blame. If he go forward, he will be praised.

data.name: Line.13.First.Image
data.value: 'Though equal for ten days, no blame' – Going beyond ten days brings disaster.

data.name: Line.13.Second.Statement
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a great tent. At noon he sees the (Great) Dipper (Ursa Major). If he go forward, he will be mistrusted and disliked. Let him show his sincerity, and thereby afford ground for joy. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.13.Second.Image
data.value: 'Covered with a great tent' – He acts as a guest, but gets the master.

data.name: Line.13.Third.Statement
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a covering flag. At noon he sees the small star. He breaks his right arm. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.13.Third.Image
data.value: 'Covered with a covering flag' – He breaks his right arm, but no blame.

data.name: Line.13.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a great tent. At noon he sees the (Great) Dipper. He meets with the ruler (who is his) counterpart. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.13.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Meeting with the ruler who is his counterpart' – This is fitting. Great good fortune.

data.name: Line.13.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The (ruler) is represented by the (fifth line, divided and) central. The result is 'brilliance.' There will be cause for congratulation and praise. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.13.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The result is brilliance' – The position is appropriate.

data.name: Line.13.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He makes his house large. He screens his family (from the world). He peeps through his door. It is still, and no one is (seen) there. For three years no one appears. There will be evil.

data.name: Line.13.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He screens his family from the world' – This is a great mistake.

data.name: Line.21.First.Statement
data.value: He drags back his wheel. He wets his tail. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.21.First.Image
data.value: 'He drags back his wheel' – (this cautious attitude is) right, and therefore there is no blame.

data.name: Line.21.Second.Statement
data.value: The woman loses her carriage curtain. Do not pursue it. In seven days you will get it.

data.name: Line.21.Second.Image
data.value: 'In seven days you will get it' – (because she adheres to) the central path (the Mean).

data.name: Line.21.Third.Statement
data.value: The Gao Zong (Emperor Wu Ding of Yin) attacked the Gui Fang region. After three years he conquered them. Small men should not be employed (in such tasks).

data.name: Line.21.Third.Image
data.value: 'After three years he conquered them' – (the state is) wearied.

data.name: Line.21.Fourth.Statement
data.value: There are rags (needed) for padding leaks in the boat. Be on guard all day long.

data.name: Line.21.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Be on guard all day long' – (because there is) something to be feared (suspicion of danger).

data.name: Line.21.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox (for sacrifice) does not equal the neighbor in the west with his simple offering, who truly receives the blessing.

data.name: Line.21.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox is not equal to the neighbor in the west' – (because the latter's offering is) timely. 'He truly receives the blessing' – for great good fortune comes (to him).

data.name: Line.21.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He gets his head immersed (in the water). There is peril.

data.name: Line.21.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He gets his head immersed. There is peril.' – How can this last long?

data.name: Line.3.First.Statement
data.value: Approaching with widespread influence (or: through feeling). Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.3.First.Image
data.value: 'Approaching with influence. Perseverance brings good fortune.' – For the will is carried out in a correct way.

data.name: Line.3.Second.Statement
data.value: Approaching with widespread influence. All is auspicious, and nothing is disadvantageous.

data.name: Line.3.Second.Image
data.value: 'Approaching with influence. All is auspicious.' – (This is so even though the one above) has not yet (fully) complied with (the natural course of) things.

data.name: Line.3.Third.Statement
data.value: Approaching with sweet words (or: complacent oversight). Nothing advantageous. If one becomes anxious about this (and mends one's ways), there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.3.Third.Image
data.value: 'Approaching with sweet words' – (this is because) the position is not appropriate (a weak line on a strong place). 'If one becomes anxious about it' – the blame will not be long-lasting.

data.name: Line.3.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Approaching in the highest sense (or: direct, intimate oversight). No blame.

data.name: Line.3.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Approaching in the highest sense. No blame.' – (Because) the position is appropriate.

data.name: Line.3.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Wise approach (or: overseeing with wisdom). This is fitting for a great prince. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.3.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'This is fitting for a great prince' – (it means) to act in accordance with the Mean (the central path).

data.name: Line.3.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Sincere, magnanimous approach (or: oversight). Good fortune. No blame.

data.name: Line.3.Sixth.Image
data.value: The good fortune of 'sincere, magnanimous approach' – (comes from) the will being directed inward (toward one's own people/country).

data.name: Line.42.First.Statement
data.value: He gets his tail immersed. Humiliation.

data.name: Line.42.First.Image
data.value: 'He gets his tail immersed' – (because) he does not know the proper limit (or: the extreme danger).

data.name: Line.42.Second.Statement
data.value: He drags back his wheel. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.42.Second.Image
data.value: The second nine's 'perseverance brings good fortune' – (is because) acting from the central position leads to correctness.

data.name: Line.42.Third.Statement
data.value: Before completion. To advance brings misfortune. (Yet) it is favorable to cross the great stream.

data.name: Line.42.Third.Image
data.value: 'Before completion. To advance brings misfortune.' – (Because) the position is not appropriate.

data.name: Line.42.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret vanishes. (With the vigor of) Thunder, he attacks the Gui Fang region. For three years (he fights), and is rewarded by the great country.

data.name: Line.42.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret vanishes.' – (For) the will is carried out.

data.name: Line.42.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. No regret. The light of the superior man (shines forth). He possesses sincerity and good faith. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.42.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The light of the superior man' – its brightness brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.42.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He possesses sincerity and (thus can) drink wine. No blame. But if he wets his head (in it), (then) although he possesses sincerity, he loses the proper measure.

data.name: Line.42.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Drinking wine and wetting his head' – (shows) he also does not know moderation.

data.name: Line.41.First.Statement
data.value: Wearing foot-shackles that injure the toes. No blame.

data.name: Line.41.First.Image
data.value: 'Wearing foot-shackles that injure the toes' – (so that) he cannot walk (in wrong paths).

data.name: Line.41.Second.Statement
data.value: Biting through tender skin and injuring the nose. No blame.

data.name: Line.41.Second.Image
data.value: 'Biting through tender skin and injuring the nose' – (because this yielding line) rides on a strong line (the first nine).

data.name: Line.41.Third.Statement
data.value: Biting through dried, tough meat and encountering poison. There is slight humiliation, but no blame.

data.name: Line.41.Third.Image
data.value: 'Encountering poison' – (because) the position is not appropriate.

data.name: Line.41.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Biting through dried gristly meat (with bone). He comes across a metal arrowhead. Perseverance in difficulty is advantageous. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.41.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance in difficulty is advantageous and leads to good fortune.' – (But the way is) not yet fully illuminated.

data.name: Line.41.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Biting through dried meat. He obtains yellow gold (or: a golden arrowhead). Perseverance (even) in danger. No blame.

data.name: Line.41.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance in danger brings no blame.' – (Because his) actions are appropriate.

data.name: Line.41.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Wearing a cangue that injures the ears. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.41.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Wearing a cangue that injures the ears' – (because) his hearing (and understanding) was not clear.

data.name: Line.31.First.Statement
data.value: Strong (like one) advancing with the forward foot. To go forward (so rashly) will lead to failure and blame.

data.name: Line.31.First.Image
data.value: 'To go forward without the prospect of success' – this leads to blame.

data.name: Line.31.Second.Statement
data.value: Crying out with alarm and vigilance. Though armed men come at night, have no fear.

data.name: Line.31.Second.Image
data.value: 'Though armed men come, have no fear.' – (Because he) has attained the central path.

data.name: Line.31.Third.Statement
data.value: Strong in the cheekbones (showing anger). There is misfortune. The superior man is resolute in his decision. He walks alone and encounters rain (which wets him). (Though) he is annoyed at being drenched, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.31.Third.Image
data.value: 'The superior man is resolute in his decision' – in the end, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.31.Fourth.Statement
data.value: No skin on his buttocks; he walks with difficulty. If he leads the sheep (the strong mass below), regret will vanish. But though he hears these words, he does not believe them.

data.name: Line.31.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He walks with difficulty' – (because) the position is not appropriate (a strong line on a weak place). 'Though he hears these words, he does not believe them' – (for) his hearing (and understanding) is not clear.

data.name: Line.31.Fifth.Statement
data.value: (He is like) the delicate xianlu plant (which is hard to uproot). He is resolute in his decision. Acting from the central position, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.31.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Acting from the central position brings no blame' – (but) the centrality (of his virtue) is not yet brilliantly displayed.

data.name: Line.31.Sixth.Statement
data.value: No cry (is of any avail). In the end, there will be misfortune.

data.name: Line.31.Sixth.Image
data.value: The misfortune of 'no cry (availing)' – (means this state of affairs) cannot last long in the end.

data.name: Line.62.First.Statement
data.value: Tied to a metal brake-block. Perseverance brings good fortune. To go forward (actively) leads to misfortune. (Like) a lean pig that is sure to keep jumping and frisking about.

data.name: Line.62.First.Image
data.value: 'Tied to a metal brake-block' – (this indicates) the way of the weak (line) is to be restrained.

data.name: Line.62.Second.Statement
data.value: There is a fish in the baul (wrapping). No blame. (But) it is not advantageous for (entertaining) guests.

data.name: Line.62.Second.Image
data.value: 'There is a fish in the baul' – (meaning) in righteousness, it should not extend to guests.

data.name: Line.62.Third.Statement
data.value: No skin on his buttocks; he walks with difficulty. There is peril, but no great blame.

data.name: Line.62.Third.Image
data.value: 'He walks with difficulty' – (but) his movement is not (yet) influenced (by the weak line).

data.name: Line.62.Fourth.Statement
data.value: No fish in the baul. To stir (to action) leads to misfortune.

data.name: Line.62.Fourth.Image
data.value: The misfortune of 'no fish' – (is due to) being distant from the people (the yin element below).

data.name: Line.62.Fifth.Statement
data.value: (He acts) like the willow that overshadows the melon (below). He contains his brilliance within. (Then) something will fall from heaven (to him).

data.name: Line.62.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The fifth nine contains his brilliance' – (because of) his central and correct position. 'Something will fall from heaven' – (for) his will does not neglect the ordinances (of Heaven).

data.name: Line.62.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Encountering with his horn (i.e., in the highest, most remote place). There is humiliation, but no blame.

data.name: Line.62.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Encountering with his horn' – (means) being at the top, one is in an exhausted and humiliating position.

data.name: Line.58.First.Statement
data.value: He does not perpetuate the affair (of contention). There will be a little gossip. In the end, there will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.58.First.Image
data.value: 'He does not perpetuate the affair' – contention should not be prolonged. Although 'there is a little gossip,' the matter will be clearly discerned.

data.name: Line.58.Second.Statement
data.value: He is unequal to the contention. He retires and flees (to avoid it). The people of his city (to the number of) three hundred households (remain undisturbed). There will be no calamity.

data.name: Line.58.Second.Image
data.value: 'He is unequal to the contention; he retires and flees' – (for) from a lower position to contend with one above, calamity comes as if gathered (upon him).

data.name: Line.58.Third.Statement
data.value: He feeds on old virtue (or: lives on his hereditary estate). Perseverance (in contention) brings danger. In the end, there will be good fortune. If he follows the king's service, he will not achieve success.

data.name: Line.58.Third.Image
data.value: 'He feeds on old virtue' – following those above brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.58.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He is unequal to the contention. He returns to (the acknowledgment of) Heaven's ordinance, changes (his attitude), and rests in perseverance. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.58.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He returns to the acknowledgment of Heaven's ordinance, changes and rests in perseverance' – he does not lose (what is proper).

data.name: Line.58.Fifth.Statement
